medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain in the right upper quadrant (RUQ)
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began having abdominal pain in the RUQ. The pain is worse with inspiration and is accompanied by nausea but no emesis. She had a similar presentation previously and a positive HIDA scan but appeared to improve with antibiotic therapy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, diverticulitis, lactose intolerance, glaucoma, right L5 radiculopathy, DJD, C. difficile colitis.
